item.title: Hytale Has Secured Development Costs for the Next Two Years
item.content:encoded:
Hytale’s pre-purchases have helped Hypixel Studios secure development costs for the next 2 years.

Hypixel Studios’ highly anticipated title, Hytale, is all set to release in early access tomorrow, January 13, 2026, and it seems that it could be a massive launch as the founder of the studios is expecting over one million players. The founder may not be wrong, as the pre-purchases alone have helped them secure capital to keep supporting the game.

Hypixel Founder Reaffirms His Commitment to Support Hytale for 10 Years

Through a new post on X (formerly Twitter), Hypixel’s founder revealed that they have “officially secured the next two years of development costs through pre-purchases.” That, along with his personal commitment to support the game for the next 10 years, will make the fans happy that the game’s future is in good hands. In the same thread, the founder also revealed that the development team now consists of over 50 developers.

For those unaware, Hytale has had a turbulent history to reach where it is now. Riot Games had closed down the game for good; however, Hypixel Studios decided to reacquire the rights of the title and breathe new life into it. The popularity of the title is now higher than ever, and the early access launch will decide what lies in the future for this sandbox game blended with RPG action and adventure.

In other news, Hytale is skipping the Steam launch initially to avoid negative reviews during early access, and a console launch is also planned. Additionally, developers have been given the green light to include a Technoblade tribute. What are your thoughts on Hytale securing development costs for the next 2 years? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Palworld facing more Pokémon rip-off allegations with the new game. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Palworld Facing More Pokémon Rip-Off Allegations With New Game
item.content:encoded:
A new official Palworld card game has been announced, scheduled to release on July 30, 2026.

The game that was dubbed Pokémon with Guns, then sued by Pokémon and Nintendo, still seems to be following the same path, with a new Palworld TCG announced. It is being developed by Bushiroad, known for card games such as Cardfight!! Vanguard, Weiß Schwarz, and many more.

Palworld TCG Arrives July 2026

A new blog post reveals that Bushiroad has announced a brand-new trading card game (TCG) based on Pocketpair’s highly popular title, Palworld. The card game will be released on July 20, 2026, allowing players to take part in 2-player competitive battles, using different strategies and tactics to deploy their favourite Pals. Players will be able to gather resources and build bases as they leverage their Pals’ unique traits to secure victory.

Palworld has faced Pokémon rip-off allegations since its announcement, with Nintendo and The Pokémon Company suing the developers for patent infringement. Announcing a new TCG based around Palworld, knowing full well that Pokémon is a dominating name in that space, is not going to help it beat those allegations. However, TCG is not a realm meant solely for creature-based games; in recent years, we have also seen games like Cyberpunk 2077 enter this realm.

In other news, Nintendo’s patent in the Palworld dispute was being reexamined by the USPTO. Additionally, the developers have addressed the possibility of releasing a story-based game in the future. What are your thoughts on Palworld TCG? Do you think the Pokémon rip-off allegations will grow even more? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Hytale developers expecting over one million players at early access launch. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Is Quarantine Zone: The Last Check on Xbox Game Pass?
item.content:encoded:
Xbox Game Pass continues to add new games to expand your gaming library, but keeping track of which games are on the service can be tricky, but Insider Gaming is here to help with the details on Quarantine Zone: The Last Check’s Game Pass status.

Launching January 12, Quarantine Zone: The Last Check puts players in control of a crucial checkpoint separating the zombie horde from survivors, tasking you with deciding who gains entry and who is denied, and the choices you make can have serious consequences.

Here’s all the important information on whether Quarantine Zone: The Last Check is on Xbox Game Pass.

Is Quarantine Zone: The Last Check on PC Game Pass?

Yes, Quarantine: The Last Check is available on PC Game Pass through subscription from day one of the launch on January 12, 2026.

Quarantine: The Last Check was a late addition to the Game Pass service for January, having not been listed in the 11 games revealed to be coming to the service this month, despite the release window aligning with the announcements.

Instead, the official Xbox social media account teased the reveal of a new game launching onto PC Game Pass imminently, then later revealed that the game in question is Quarantine: The Last Check, meaning PC players have a new game to enjoy as part of their subscription.

Is Quarantine Zone: The Last Check on Xbox Game Pass For Consoles?

No, Quarantine: The Last Check will not be available to Xbox Game Pass subscribers on Xbox One and Xbox Series X|S. Instead, only those with PC Game Pass will be able to play.

Quarantine: The Last Check launches as a PC exclusive and is not available on other platforms, such as PlayStation and the Xbox family of consoles. Therefore, you need a PC to play the game.

The good news is that Microsoft’s many tiers of Game Pass subscriptions include a host of PC games, though you will, of course, require a platform to play them on, and, at the time of writing, it has not been confirmed which level of Game Pass is required to access Quarantine: The Last Check on PC.

It’s likely an Ultimate subscription will be required, however, as this is the tier that features day one releases across both platforms, whereas the Premium subscription brings new Xbox-published games to the service within 12 months of launch.

Are you jumping into Quarantine Zone: The Last Check as soon as it is released? Share your plans in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, check out the confirmed release time for Hytale, and take a look at the biggest games releasing this week.
